page.title: 04The Primary School,Leverton
page.content: Our school was built in{1873 }and opened with one teacher and a helper. We now have 24 children,11 girls and 13 boys,aged from 5 to 11 and two teachers,{Mr.Ditchburn,the headteacher and{Mrs.Fletcher.}The school is one of the oldest buildings in Leverton because, apart from the church,there is only one other building more than 200 years old.The school is a typical Victorian building which has been altered over the years to make it warmer,lighter and leak-proof but you can still see traces of the old windows and doors. Until the building of the local secondary school in the 1960's children used to stay at Leverton School until they were old enough to leave to go to work.Most children cycle to school,a few walk and some come by car especially when it rains.
